choices.text: Yourself (or minor child for whom you are legal guardian)

elements.name: info_part_a_1
elements.html:
You may only file a complaint on behalf of someone else if you are authorized to do so. Please use our representative authorization form:


Authorization to act as a representative for a privacy complaint (PDF, 99 KB)

You must submit the completed form signed by the complainant as an attachment to your complaint.

We will not be able to process the complaint without the completed signed authorization form.

elements.name: institution
elements.title: Which federal government institution is your complaint againts?

elements.name: info_part_a_2
elements.html:
• If the relevant institution is not listed, it may be covered by private sector or provincial privacy legislation. To find out where to address an issue covered by another privacy law, refer to the summary of privacy laws in Canada.
  • If after consulting this page you are still unsure of the institution, please contact OPC's Information Center.
  • After submitting the complaint, you will have the opportunity to file a different privacy complaint about the same institution or file the same type of complaint about another institution without having to re-enter all your information.

elements.name: raised_concern_writing
elements.title: Have you raised your privacy concerns in writing with the institution's [](http://www.tbs-sct.gc.ca/ap/atip-aiprp/coord-eng.asp) Access to Information and Privacy (ATIP) Coordinator?

elements.name: info_part_b_1
elements.html: Before filing a complaint with our office, we encourage you first to attempt to address your concerns directly with the institution. Many times you can resolve privacy issues through direct communication with the Access to Information and Privacy (ATIP) Coordinator. To find this person, please consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution.

pages.name: page_steps_taken_2
pages.title: Part B: Steps taken (Concerns raised with institution) - Privacy complaint form (federal institution)

elements.html: If you have already raised your privacy concern with the institution, and you still have any of the following concerns, please click on any relevant choices below for further information.

The institution has not responded.

Please allow some time for the institution to respond and resolve your issue before filing a complaint with us. Usually, it is reasonable to allow 3 to 5 weeks.

The institution has not made the changes you asked for or given you the information you are looking for.

Please be sure to check that your correspondence with the institution was clear about the exact changes or information you are seeking. Consider making a final summary of your concerns and what you are seeking in case the institution did not fully understand.

The institution has not compensated you for what happened.

Please be aware that our office does not have the power to order compensation. Usually, people need to take legal action to pursue compensation. You may wish to consult a lawyer for more information.

The employee(s) responsible for what happened have not been held accountable.

Generally, an institution is accountable for how its employees handle personal information. This could mean taking steps to prevent a similar problem in the future. The institution might change its systems, processes and training, or discipline the employee. The decision to discipline an employee is complex and must be made carefully by the institution. Our office cannot order disciplinary action.

Also, the Privacy Act does not give complainants the right to know if an employee was disciplined and institutions will not usually release this information.

Don't think it will help

Before filing a complaint with our office, we encourage you first to attempt to address your concerns directly with the institution. Many times you can resolve privacy issues through direct communication with the Access to Information and Privacy (ATIP) Coordinator. To find this person please consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution
Can't find the contactPlease consult the list of Access to Information and Privacy Coordinators by institution.

Wish to stay anonymous

Please note that yourname (except in extraordinary circumstances) and the details of your complaint will be shared with the institution that is the subject of the complaint.

We may for the purpose of the investigation share personal information with the institution and may collect personal information from that institution.

We do not otherwise disclose the information you, provide unless, such a,disclosure is in accordance, with the subsection 8(2) of the, Privacy Act, which is,reserved for,limited situations. In the case of such a disclosure we will only disclose,the information that is required and wherever possible will inform you.

The personal information you provide,on our complaint form is protected under the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act

If you wish to just tell us about an issue and not have your identity revealed use our online form to share a privacy comment or an issue without filing a formal complaint At our Commissioner's discretion we can look into matters without a person making a complaint.

Ending your session

If, If, based on any of the information above, you're not sure if you want to continue with your complaint now, you can end your session and return to file a complaint later.

Continuing with your complaint

If you wish to continue your complaint, you will need to attach copies of your correspondence with the institution (if any) about your privacy concern at the end of this form.

pages.name: page_review_and_send
pages.title: Part C: Details (Type of complaint) - Privacy complaint form (federal institution)

elements.name: type_complaint
elements.title: Which of the following choices most accurately summarizes your complaint?

choices.htmlAdditionalInfo: The institution has not responded to your access or correction request within the statutory time limits. Under the Privacy Act institutions have thirty (30) days after your request is received to respond (or 60 days if an extension has been properly invoked for an access request).

choices.text: Objecting to institutions' request for an extension to respond (to your access request)
choices.htmlAdditionalInfo: Institutions may seek, with a reason set out in the Act, an extension of a further thirty (30) days to respond.

choices.text: Denial of access to personal information
choices.htmlAdditionalInfo: Personal information has not been received, either because some documents or information are missing or the institution has applied exemptions to withhold information.

choices.text: Response to formal request for access to personal information not provided in the official language or alternative format requested
Lack of correction of personal information (notation)
choices.htmlAdditionalInfo: The institution has not corrected the information or placed a notation on the file showing the requested correction.

Personal information has been collected that is not required for an operating program or activity of the institution; personal information is not collected directly from the individual concerned; or the individual is not advised of the purpose of the collection of personal information.

choices.text: Wrongful use or disclosure of personal information
choices.htmlAdditionalInfo: Personal information has been used or disclosed without the consent of the individual and does not meet one of the permissible uses or disclosures without consent set out in sections 7 and 8 of the Privacy Act.

choices.text: Wrongful retention or disposal of personal information
choices.htmlAdditionalInfo: Personal information has not been kept in accordance with retention and disposal schedules (approved by National Archives); either destroyed too soon or kept too long. Personal information used for an administrative purpose must be kept for at least two years after the last administrative action unless the individual consents to its disposal.

elements.name: WhatWouldResolveYourComplaintDetailsPA
elements.title: What would resolve your concerns? (maximum 5,000 characters)
elements.htmldescription:
Please describe any steps or remedies that would resolve your concerns. For example:

  • for an employee to receive training
  • a change in a practice
  • getting a specific piece of information

Please note our Office does not have the power to fine organizations or award damages

Note that our Commissioner does not have the power to force a government institution to take a specific action.

The Commissioner makes findings and recommendations and works with institutions to improve their management of personal information.

Our office does not have the power to fine institutions or seek damages for complaints. Also, we do not address criminal or civil culpability.

pages.name: page_documentation
pages.title: Part C: Details (Section 4: Documentation) - Privacy complaint form (federal institution)

elements.name: documentation_info
elements.html:
Based on your responses so far, you should attach the following documents with your complaint:

  • a copy of any written responses you received from the organization about your privacy concerns
  • a copy of your request to the institution
  • a copy of your correspondence with the institution about your privacy concerns, including your attempts to escalate your concerns to the institution's Access to Information and Privacy (ATIP) Coordinator

You can either attach supporting documents to this online complaint or you can mail documents separately.

elements.name: documentation_type
elements.title: Do you wish to upload your supporting documents or send them by mail?

choices.text: I have no supporting documents to provide

elements.name: documentation_info_2
elements.html: Please be aware that we might need documents to support your allegation before we can accept a complaint.

elements.name: documentation_uploading_file_types
elements.html:
We accept the following file types: doc, docx, xls, xlsx, ppt, pptx, wpd, csv, pdf, jpg, jpeg, gif, txt, rtf, tif, and tiff.

We cannot process a complaint submission until all relevant information is received. You can upload files up to a total of 25 MB.
